title: BuildWise
description: A construction project management tool for tracking progress and budgets.
introduction: In the construction industry, effective project management is crucial for timely and within-budget delivery. BuildWise was created to address the common challenges faced by project managers, contractors, and stakeholders by providing a comprehensive tool for tracking progress and managing budgets efficiently.

sections.title: Motivation
sections.body: The construction industry often faces issues with delays and budget overruns due to poor project management. We identified a need for a tool that could streamline tracking and budgeting processes. Our motivation was to create a user-friendly platform that could be accessed by all stakeholders, ensuring transparency and accountability. We decided to use React for the frontend because of its flexibility and JavaScript for the backend to handle real-time data efficiently.

sections.title: Initial Development
sections.body: We started by laying out the basic framework of the tool. Setting up user authentication was our first challenge, but we successfully implemented it using OAuth. Next, we focused on creating a dashboard that displays key metrics like project timelines and budget allocations. Integrating a real-time chat feature for team communication was another hurdle, but we managed it by using Socket.io.

sections.title: Feature Development
sections.body: Developing the progress tracking feature was crucial. We decided to use a Gantt chart for visual representation of timelines, which required integrating a third-party library. For budget management, we implemented a feature that allows setting budget limits and sends alerts when expenditures exceed those limits. Ensuring that these features were user-friendly was a challenge, but we achieved it through rigorous testing and feedback sessions.

sections.title: Testing and Iteration
sections.body: Testing the tool was a critical phase. We conducted user testing sessions with actual project managers and contractors to gather feedback. One major challenge was optimizing the performance of the Gantt chart for large projects with many tasks. We addressed this by implementing lazy loading and optimizing the database queries. Based on feedback, we also added a feature to generate detailed reports, which involved integrating a reporting library and customizing it to meet user needs.

sections.title: Launch and Future Plans
sections.body: After extensive testing and iterations, we successfully launched BuildWise. The initial response from the industry has been positive, with users appreciating the tool's ease of use and comprehensive features. Moving forward, we plan to add AI-powered predictive analytics to forecast potential delays and budget issues. We also aim to expand the tool's capabilities to handle international projects by incorporating multiple currencies and regional compliance standards.
